full_summary:
**National Standing Offer for Radar Speed Measuring Equipment**
[Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) Tender Notice]
**Goods and Services Identification Number (GSIN): None**
**Solicitation:** cb-216-43204372 
**Amendment:** 6
**Publication Date:** 2023-10-04

**Introduction:**
The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) invites industry suppliers to submit tenders for a national individual standing offer (IOS) for radar speed measuring equipment. The contract will be awarded as a one (1) year agreement with three (3) additional one (1) year options.

**Contract Requirements:**
The successful supplier will be required to deliver the radar speed measuring equipment within 30 days of receipt of a call-up order. The basis of selection will be the lowest compliant bid.

**Submission Procedure:**
Tenders must be submitted electronically to the designated email address: Daniel.caughey@rcmp-grc.gc.ca. Both English and French language tenders will be accepted.

**Procuring Office:**
Dan Caughey, Procurement Officer
Royal Canadian Mounted Police
73 Leikin Dr, MS #15
Ottawa, ON K1A 0R2

**Additional Information:**
The RCMP has implemented the Integrity Regime administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada. As such, the integrity provisions will be applied to this procurement.

**Notices:**
Canada will make available notices of proposed procurements (NPP), bid solicitations, and related documents for download through the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) website. The Crown retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement.

**Closing Date and Time:** 2023-10-31T14:00:00

**Expected Contract Commencement and End Date:**
2023-11-15 to 2024-11-15

[ Attachments: 
    * Radar Speed Measuring Equipment - RFSA-B_en.pdf 
    * Radar Speed Measuring Equipment - RFSA-B_fr.pdf]

Note: The RCMP contract process will be managed in accordance with the Government of Canada's Trade Agreements and the Integrity Regime. Interested suppliers must submit their tenders in accordance with the solicitation requirements. All correspondence should be directed to the Procuring Office contact.
